channel.title: BBC News - World
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Afghanistan: Taliban announce new rules for female students
item.description: Students will be segregated by gender and have to observe a dress code.

item.title: It means everything - Raducanu on historic US Open win
item.description: Emma Raducanu says she does not want to let go of the US Open trophy as her fairy tale in New York culminates in the ultimate happy ending.

item.title: FBI begins declassifying documents into Saudi 9/11 links
item.description: The memo lists some contact between Saudi nationals and hijackers, but does not implicate the government.

item.title: Pope warns of anti-Semitism as he visits Hungary
item.description: Francis also meets PM Viktor Orban, who holds starkly divergent views on immigration and refugees.

item.title: Match crowd catches falling cat in a flag
item.description: The cat used one of its nine lives at the American football match in Miami Gardens, Florida.

item.title: Iran and UN watchdog reach deal over nuclear site monitoring
item.description: Tehran allows the UN's nuclear watchdog to service monitoring cameras at key facilities.

item.title: Paris residents alarmed by air force drill on 9/11 anniversary
item.description: A fighter jet was escorting an Airbus A330 - with PM Jean Castex on board - at low altitude.

item.title: Venice Film Festival: Abortion drama wins top prize
item.description: Audrey Diwan's Happening is set in 1960s France but comes amid debate over strict new laws in Texas.

item.title: Yes Sir, I Can Boogie singer dies aged 69
item.description: María Mendiola, one of the members of the duo Baccara, has died in Madrid at the age of 69.

item.title: Ricciardo wins Italian GP after Hamilton & Verstappen crash
item.description: McLaren's Daniel Ricciardo won the Italian Grand Prix after a harrowing crash between title rivals Lewis Hamilton and Max Verstappen.

item.title: Air India Express: Deadly plane crash blamed on human error
item.description: Failure to follow procedures contributed to last year's crash at Calicut airport, investigators say.

item.title: Haiti PM asked to testify in President's assassination hearing
item.description: Ariel Henry has been asked why he spoke to the main suspect in the slaying of President Moise.

item.title: US remembers 20th anniversary of 9/11
item.description: Ceremonies are held in New York, Virginia and Pennsylvania to mark the lives lost 20 years ago.

item.title: Guantanamo Bay: In a courtroom, just feet away from 9/11 suspects
item.description: Aleem Maqbool was one of only a handful of journalists in court to see the 9/11 hearings unfold.

item.title: Obituary: Abimael Guzmán, philosophy don-turned-revolutionary
item.description: Guzmán led the Maoist rebel group which in the 1980s almost brought the Peruvian state to its knees.

item.title: Keeping up with the Californians: Recall vote 2021
item.description: A ragtag bunch of 46 challengers hope voters will remove the governor and let them run California.

item.title: Why are there food queues in Sri Lanka?
item.description: With a weak economy and worsening Covid-19 situation, a food emergency has been declared in the country.

item.title: Nigeria's kidnap crisis: Letters replace phones
item.description: The latest tactic to tackle kidnapping gangs is to cut off mobiles and the internet.

item.title: Afghanistan: BBC catches up with Afghan journalist who fled Kabul
item.description: Wahida Faizi spoke to a reporter in August saying she feared the Taliban would kill her for her work.

item.title: The first hate-crime attack after 9/11
item.description: The story of the first American to be killed in the backlash - a turbaned Sikh man in Arizona.

item.title: Families and leaders mark 20th anniversary of 9/11
item.description: Commemorations have taken place on the 20th anniversary of the 11 September attacks.

item.title: 9/11 anniversary: Moment of silence as families recite names of victims
item.description: On the 20th anniversary of the 9/11 attack, New York City held a moment of silence for the lost 2,977 lives.

item.title: ICYMI: A big week for small things
item.description: Here's a round-up of some the week's news you might have missed.

item.title: Red carpet debut for 'Bennifer' 2.0 in Venice
item.description: Ben Affleck and Jennifer Lopez arrive in Venice for the premiere of The Last Duel.

item.title: US Open: Emma Raducanu - the key facts about Britain's Grand Slam winner
item.description: Motorsport, Romania and Dina Asher-Smith - a few things you should know about Britain's teenage US Open champion Emma Raducanu.

item.title: Emma Raducanu on being US Open champ, the Queen and chocolate
item.description: Emma Raducanu talks about being US Open champion, her victory treat and her message from the Queen.

item.title: Emma Raducanu: US Open champion 'outstanding', says the Queen
item.description: The Queen leads the congratulations to Emma Raducanu after the 18-year-old Briton clinches the US Open title with victory against Leylah Fernandez.

item.title: Emma Raducanu's hometown celebrates US Open win
item.description: This is how people in Bromley, London – including her former tennis coach – reacted to the result.

item.title: US Open: Canadian teen Leylah Fernandez's remarkable run
item.description: The 19-year-old thrilled fans during the US Open, where she lost in the final to GB's Emma Raducanu
